title: Esmog dot font?
content:
Anyone know what this might be? They might have made it into dots, dunno.

Thanks, B.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005225im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1160059619_5720.jpg)
author: Biff

comments.content:
Elektrosmog are well known for using/creating custom typography / typefaces for their work. _(So that may as well be custom made.)_

That said, you may find commercially available Esmog types at Lineto.

Dav

I believe this could be the one by Jon Hares as discovered by [zachary](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005225/http:/typophile.com/user/12832) in my post on dot fonts [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005225/http:/typophile.com/node/30152), where you can find other proposals... Good dot fonts are obviously hard to find... Eventually I did my own take on the dot type for a project but it didn't work that great and I eventually didn't use it (also I suck as a typographer...)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150321005225im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PP_5416.jpg)
